title: Update public contact email and restore prior default service-card images

requirements.summary: Update shared contact config so all UI displays the new public email ceilingpro9@gmail.com (at minimum Contact section and Footer).
acceptanceCriteria: The Contact section email link uses mailto:ceilingpro9@gmail.com and displays "ceilingpro9@gmail.com"
No customer-facing UI still shows the old email value

file_operations.description: Update CEILING_PRO_CONFIG.email to "ceilingpro9@gmail.com" so all components using shared contact config render the new email.
Confirm the Contact section renders the email exclusively from CEILING_PRO_CONFIG.email (no hardcoded fallback), ensuring the mailto: link and visible text reflect the new value.
Confirm the footer renders the email exclusively from CEILING_PRO_CONFIG.email (no hardcoded fallback), ensuring it reflects the new value everywhere it appears.

requirements.summary: Restore prior default images for the 4 "Our Services" service cards using the previous /images/service*.jpg-style paths while keeping admin-configured image paths as overrides.
acceptanceCriteria: The "Our Services" section service-card images render using the restored previous image paths (not the newer generated defaults)
All 4 service cards show non-broken images on a hard refresh
The service card images remain individually controllable via the existing image-paths mechanism (admin image paths), with the restored images acting as defaults where appropriate

file_operations.description: Switch the default/fallback serviceCard1-4 image paths from the newer generated assets to the prior /images/service*.jpg-style defaults, while preserving the existing override behavior when backend-provided image paths are non-empty.

Update the SERVICES[].imagePath defaults for the four services to match the restored prior /images/service*.jpg-style paths so ServicesSection defaults align with the restored images when no overrides are provided.
Update helper/placeholder text for the service-card image path inputs to reflect the restored prior /images/service*.jpg-style default paths (without changing the admin override mechanism).
Add/restore the prior default Service Card 1 image file so /images/service1.jpg loads reliably on hard refresh (ensure filename matches the chosen default path).
Add/restore the prior default Service Card 2 image file so /images/service2.jpg loads reliably on hard refresh (ensure filename matches the chosen default path).
Add/restore the prior default Service Card 3 image file so /images/service3.jpg loads reliably on hard refresh (ensure filename matches the chosen default path).
Add/restore the prior default Service Card 4 image file so /images/service4.jpg loads reliably on hard refresh (ensure filename matches the chosen default path).
